description: The virtual machine dashboard displays the configuration details and resource usage metrics of a selected virtual machine.

panels.content: ###### The virtual machine dashboard displays the configuration details and resource usage metrics of a selected virtual machine.

panels.description: The data center, cluster, host that the virtual machine is currently running on, and description. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT DISTINCT
    'No' AS is_deleted,
    host_id,
    CASE
        WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date IS NULL
            THEN datacenter_name
        WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date IS NOT NULL
            THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')' 
    END AS datacenter_name,
    CASE
        WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date IS NULL
            THEN cluster_name
        WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date IS NOT NULL
            THEN cluster_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'
    END AS cluster_name,
    host_name,
    vm_description
FROM
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms
    INNER JOIN
    v4_4_configuration_history_clusters
        ON
            (
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms.history_id
                    IN
                        (
                            SELECT MAX (history_id)
                            FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms
                            WHERE vm_id = ('$vm_id')
                        )
                AND v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.history_id
                    IN
                        (
                            SELECT MAX (history_id)
                            FROM v4_4_configuration_history_clusters
                            GROUP BY cluster_id
                        )
            )
      INNER JOIN 
      v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters
          ON
              (
                  v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.datacenter_id =
                  v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters.datacenter_id
                  AND v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters.history_id
                      IN
                          (
                              SELECT MAX (history_id)
                              FROM v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters
                              GROUP BY datacenter_id
                          )
              )
      LEFT OUTER JOIN
      v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
          ON
              (
                  v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                  v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id
                  AND v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.history_id
                      IN
                          (
                              SELECT MAX (history_id)
                              FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                              WHERE vm_id = ('$vm_id')
                          )
              )
      LEFT OUTER JOIN
      v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
          ON
              (
                  v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.currently_running_on_host =
                  v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_id
                  AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.history_id
                      IN
                          (
                              SELECT MAX (history_id)
                              FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
                              GROUP BY host_id
                          )
              )

panels.description: The latest configuration details of the virtual machine.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR9 - This query will return
-- the latest VM configurations.

SELECT DISTINCT
    a.value AS os_version,
    vm_ip,
    CAST ( v4_4_configuration_history_vms.create_date AS date ) AS create_date,
    CASE 
        WHEN delete_date IS NULL
            THEN update_date
        ELSE NULL
    END AS update_date,
    CASE
        WHEN delete_date IS NOT NULL
            THEN delete_date
        ELSE NULL
    END AS delete_date
FROM 
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms
    LEFT OUTER JOIN 
    (
        SELECT enum_type, enum_key, value
        FROM enum_translator
        WHERE language_code = 'en_US' AND enum_type = 'OS_TYPE'
    )AS a
        ON 
            (
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms.operating_system =
                a.enum_key AND a.enum_type = 'OS_TYPE'
            )
    LEFT OUTER JOIN
    v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
        ON
            (
                v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id =
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
                AND v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.history_id
                    IN
                        (
                            SELECT MAX (history_id)
                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                            GROUP BY vm_id
                        )
            )
WHERE 
    -- Here we filter by the virtual machine/s chosen by the user
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms.history_id
        IN
            (
                SELECT MAX (history_id)
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms
                GROUP BY vm_id
            )

panels.description: The status of the virtual machine. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT DISTINCT
    CASE
        WHEN vm_status = -1
            THEN 'Unknown Status'
        WHEN vm_status = 0
            THEN 'Down'
        WHEN vm_status = 1
            THEN 'Up'
        WHEN vm_status = 2
            THEN 'Paused'
        WHEN max (vm_status) = 3
            THEN 'Problematic'
        ELSE NULL
    END
FROM 
    v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples 
WHERE
    vm_id = ('$vm_id')
    AND history_id
        IN
            (
                SELECT MAX (history_id)
                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                GROUP BY vm_id
            )
GROUP BY vm_status

panels.title: Status

panels.description: High Availability (true or false). In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    CASE 
        WHEN high_availability = 'false'
            THEN 'False'
        WHEN high_availability = 'true'
            THEN 'True'
        ELSE NULL
    END 
FROM 
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms
WHERE 
    -- Here we filter by the virtual machine chosen by the user
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
    -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
        IN 
            (
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms a
                GROUP BY a.vm_id
            )
GROUP BY 
    vm_id, 
    high_availability

panels.title: High Availability

panels.description: The number of CPU cores of the virtual machine. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    ROUND ( COALESCE ( cpu_per_socket, 0 ) * COALESCE ( number_of_sockets, 0 ), 0 ) AS vm_cpucores
FROM 
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms
WHERE 
    -- Here we filter by the virtual machine chosen by the user
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
    -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
        IN 
            (
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms a
                GROUP BY a.vm_id
            )
GROUP BY
    vm_id, 
    cpu_per_socket, 
    number_of_sockets

panels.title: CPU Cores

panels.description: The memory size of the virtual machine. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( memory_size_mb, 0.00 ) AS float ) :: numeric / 1024, 1 ) AS vm_memsize
FROM 
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms
WHERE 
    -- Here we filter by the virtual machine chosen by the user
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
    -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
        IN 
            (
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms a
                GROUP BY a.vm_id
            )
GROUP BY 
    vm_id, 
    memory_size_mb

panels.title: Memory Size

panels.description: The total disks size of the virtual machine. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT SUM (vm_disk_size_mb)
FROM
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            vm_disk_name,
            (CAST ( COALESCE ( vm_disk_size_mb, 0.00 ) AS float ) :: numeric / 1024) AS vm_disk_size_mb
        FROM
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
                ON
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id =
                        v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
                        AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.history_id 
                            IN 
                                ( 
                                    SELECT MAX (history_id) 
                                    FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices 
                                    WHERE type = 'disk' 
                                    GROUP BY device_id
                                )
                    )
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks
                ON
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id =
                        v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.device_id
                    )
            LEFT OUTER JOIN 
            v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
                ON
                    (
                        v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples.vm_disk_id =
                        v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id
                        AND v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples.history_id
                            IN
                                (
                                    SELECT MAX (history_id)
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
                                    GROUP BY vm_disk_id
                                )
                    )
        WHERE 
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.history_id 
                IN
                    (
                        SELECT MAX (history_id)
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks
                        GROUP BY vm_disk_id
                    )
    ) AS sub_queries

panels.title: Total Disk Size

panels.description: The uptime percentage of the virtual machine, over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR6 - This query returns the average
-- uptime percent for the selected vm

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT
    (
        -- Here we sum the total uptime
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN statistics.vm_status = 1
                        THEN COALESCE ( statistics.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        /
        -- Here we sum the total time
        SUM 
            (
                statistics.minutes_in_status
            )
    ) * 100 AS uptime_mins_percent
FROM 
    (
        SELECT vm_id, vm_status, minutes_in_status, history_datetime
        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
    ) AS statistics
    INNER JOIN 
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms
        ON 
            (
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                statistics.vm_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
    -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back
    AND $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
    AND statistics.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
    AND statistics.history_datetime < $__timeTo()

-- DR6 - This query returns the average
-- uptime percent for the selected vm

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT
    (
        -- Here we sum the total uptime
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN statistics.vm_status = 1
                        THEN COALESCE ( statistics.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        /
        -- Here we sum the total time
        SUM 
            (
                statistics.minutes_in_status
            )
    ) * 100 AS uptime_mins_percent
FROM 
    (
            SELECT vm_id, vm_status, minutes_in_status, history_datetime
            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
        UNION
            SELECT vm_id, vm_status, minutes_in_status, history_datetime
            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
            WHERE
                history_datetime <
                    (
                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                    )
    ) AS statistics
    INNER JOIN 
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms
        ON 
            (
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                statistics.vm_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
    -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
    AND $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
    AND statistics.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
    AND statistics.history_datetime < $__timeTo()

panels.title: Uptime (DR6)

panels.description: The CPU usage percentage of the virtual machine. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR12 - This query returns the average
-- resources that are used ( cpu and memory )
-- for the selected vm

SELECT
    cpu_usage_percent_avg AS average_cpu_used
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            AVG ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_usage_percent_avg
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT vm_id, vm_status, cpu_usage_percent
                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                WHERE 
                    history_id
                        IN
                            (
                                SELECT MAX (history_id)
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                                GROUP BY vm_id
                            )
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_configuration_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id =
                        statistics.vm_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we get only active vm
            statistics.vm_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
            AND v4_4_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
    ) AS average_cpu_percent

panels.title: CPU Usage (DR12)

panels.description: The Memory usage percentage of the virtual machine. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR12 - This query returns the average
-- resources that are used ( cpu and memory )
-- for the selected vm

SELECT
    memory_usage_percent_avg AS average_memory_used
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            AVG ( memory_usage_percent ) AS memory_usage_percent_avg
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT vm_id, vm_status, memory_usage_percent
                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                WHERE 
                    history_id
                        IN
                            (
                                SELECT MAX (history_id)
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                                GROUP BY vm_id
                            )
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_configuration_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id =
                        statistics.vm_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we get only active vm
            statistics.vm_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
            AND v4_4_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
    ) AS average_memory_percent

panels.title: Memory Usage (DR12)

panels.description: The Disks usage percentage of the virtual machine. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
    CASE 
        WHEN SUM (COALESCE ( vm_disk_size_mb, 0.00 )) = 0
            THEN NULL
        ELSE SUM (COALESCE ( vm_disk_actual_size_mb, 0.00 )) / SUM (COALESCE ( vm_disk_size_mb, 0.00 ))
    END
FROM
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms
    INNER JOIN 
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
        ON
            (
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id =
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
                AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.history_id 
                    IN 
                        ( 
                            SELECT MAX (history_id) 
                            FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices 
                            WHERE type = 'disk' 
                            GROUP BY device_id
                        )
            )
    INNER JOIN 
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks
        ON
            (
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id =
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.device_id
            )
    LEFT OUTER JOIN 
    v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
        ON
            (
                v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples.vm_disk_id =
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id
                AND v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples.history_id
                    IN
                        (
                            SELECT MAX (history_id)
                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
                            GROUP BY vm_disk_id
                        )
            )
WHERE v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id = ('$vm_id')

panels.title: Disk Usage

panels.description: The disks name, size, and used size of the virtual machine. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT DISTINCT
    CASE          
        WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.delete_date IS NULL  	     	    
            THEN vm_disk_name 	 	
        WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    
            THEN vm_disk_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  
    END AS vm_disk_name,
    (CAST ( COALESCE ( vm_disk_size_mb, 0.00 ) AS float ) :: numeric / 1024) AS vm_disk_size_mb,
    (CAST ( COALESCE ( vm_disk_actual_size_mb, 0.00 ) AS float ) :: numeric / 1024) AS vm_disk_actual_size_mb
FROM
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms
    INNER JOIN 
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
        ON
            (
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id =
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
                AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.history_id 
                    IN 
                        ( 
                            SELECT MAX (history_id) 
                            FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices 
                            WHERE type = 'disk' 
                            GROUP BY device_id
                        )
            )
    INNER JOIN 
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks
        ON
            (
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id =
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.device_id
            )
    LEFT OUTER JOIN
    v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
        ON
            (
                v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples.vm_disk_id =
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id
                AND v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples.history_id
                    IN
                        (
                            SELECT MAX (history_id)
                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
                            GROUP BY vm_disk_id
                        )
            )
WHERE 
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.history_id 
        IN
            (
                SELECT MAX (history_id)
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks
                GROUP BY vm_disk_id
            )

panels.title: Disk Inventory

panels.description: The latest virtual machine interfaces configuration details.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT DISTINCT
    CASE          
        WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.delete_date IS NULL  	     	    
            THEN vm_interface_name 	 	
        WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    
            THEN vm_interface_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  
    END AS vm_interface_name,
    CASE
        WHEN vm_interface_type = 0
            THEN 'rt18139_pv'
        WHEN vm_interface_type = 1
            THEN 'rt18139'
        WHEN vm_interface_type = 2
            THEN 'e1000'
        WHEN vm_interface_type = 3
            THEN 'pv'
        ELSE NULL
    END AS vm_interface_type,
    mac_address,
    logical_network_name,
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.create_date,
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.update_date
FROM 
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces
    INNER JOIN
    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
        ON
            (
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id =
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.device_id
                AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_configuration_version =
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_configuration_version
                AND type = 'interface'
                AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.history_id
                    IN
                        (
                            SELECT MAX (history_id)
                            FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces
                            GROUP BY vm_interface_id
                        )
            )
WHERE 
    vm_id = ('$vm_id')

panels.title: Interface Inventory

panels.description: Average CPU usage and peaks of the virtual machine, over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VM average CPU usage and peaks
-- over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT
    $__time(time),
    CPU_Usage AS "CPU Usage",
    CPU_Peak AS "CPU Peak"
FROM 
    (
        -- Here we get the vm Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( cpu_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_cpu_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Peak
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, cpu_usage_percent AS max_cpu_usage, vm_status, vm_id
                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS samples_hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active vm only
            samples_hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
            AND samples_hourly_daily.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    time, 
    CPU_Usage, 
    CPU_Peak
ORDER BY time

-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VM average CPU usage and peaks
-- over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT
    $__time(time),
    CPU_Usage AS "CPU Usage",
    CPU_Peak AS "CPU Peak"
FROM 
    (
        -- Here we get the vm Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( cpu_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_cpu_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Peak
        FROM 
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_cpu_usage, vm_status, vm_id
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_cpu_usage, vm_status, vm_id
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS samples_hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active vm only
            samples_hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
            AND samples_hourly_daily.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    time, 
    CPU_Usage, 
    CPU_Peak
ORDER BY time

panels.title: Average and Peak CPU Usage (over time) (BR10A)

panels.description: Average memory usage and peaks of the virtual machine, over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VM average memory usage and peaks
-- over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT
    $__time(time),
    MEM_Usage AS "Memory Usage",
    MEM_Peak AS "Memory Peak"
FROM 
    (
        -- Here we get the vm Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( memory_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_memory_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Peak
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, memory_usage_percent AS max_memory_usage, vm_status, vm_id
                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS samples_hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active vm only
            samples_hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
            AND samples_hourly_daily.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    time, 
    MEM_Usage, 
    MEM_Peak
ORDER BY time

-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VM average memory usage and peaks
-- over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT
    $__time(time),
    MEM_Usage AS "Memory Usage",
    MEM_Peak AS "Memory Peak"
FROM 
    (
        -- Here we get the vm Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( memory_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_memory_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Peak
        FROM 
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_memory_usage, vm_status, vm_id
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_memory_usage, vm_status, vm_id
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS samples_hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active vm only
            samples_hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
            AND samples_hourly_daily.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    time, 
    MEM_Usage, 
    MEM_Peak
ORDER BY time

panels.title: Average and Peak Memory Usage (over time) (BR10A)

panels.description: Average read and write rates of the virtual machine disks, over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VM Disk Read_Rate, Write_Rate Usage
-- over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS disk_name,
    AVG ( Read_Rate ) AS "Read Rate",
    AVG ( Write_Rate ) AS "Write Rate"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN vm_disk_name
                ELSE vm_disk_name || '*'
            END AS disk_name,
            history_datetime AS Time,
            AVG ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( read_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric / ( 1024 * 1024 ), 1 ) ) AS Read_Rate,
            AVG ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( write_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric / ( 1024 * 1024 ), 1 ) ) AS Write_Rate
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, read_rate_bytes_per_second, write_rate_bytes_per_second
                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id =
                        statistics.vm_disk_id
                    )
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we filter by the latest vm disks configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS a
                        GROUP BY a.vm_disk_id
                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.vm_disk_id
                        FROM 
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, vm_disk_status, read_rate_bytes_per_second, write_rate_bytes_per_second
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS c
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        c.vm_disk_id = 
                                        b.vm_disk_id
                                    )
                            WHERE
                                -- Here we filter by active vm disks only
                                b.vm_disk_status = 1
                                AND c.vm_disk_id 
                                    IN 
                                        (
                                            SELECT device_id
                                            FROM 
                                                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                                INNER JOIN 
                                                (
                                                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status
                                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                                                ) AS samples_hourly_daily
                                                    ON
                                                        (
                                                            samples_hourly_daily.vm_configuration_version =
                                                            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_configuration_version
                                                        )
                                            WHERE
                                                -- Here we filter by active vm only
                                                samples_hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
                                                -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
                                                AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
                                                AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                                                AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                                -- Here we get the latest vm devices configuration
                                                AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.history_id 
                                                    IN 
                                                        (
                                                            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                            FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices a
                                                            GROUP BY 
                                                                a.vm_id, 
                                                                a.device_id
                                                        )
                                        )
                                -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
                                AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                -- Here we get the latest vm disks configuration
                                AND c.history_id 
                                    IN 
                                        (
                                            SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                            FROM  v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS d
                                            GROUP BY d.vm_disk_id
                                        )
                            GROUP BY c.vm_disk_id
                            -- Here we sort by the disks that have the max read and write rate.
                            ORDER BY 
                                AVG ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( b.read_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric, 1 ) ) +
                                AVG ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( b.write_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric, 1 ) ) 
                                DESC
                    )
        GROUP BY
            statistics.vm_disk_id,
            disk_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY
    all_sub_queries.time,
    disk_name
ORDER BY
    all_sub_queries.time,
    COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' )

-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VM Disk Read_Rate, Write_Rate Usage
-- over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS disk_name,
    AVG ( Read_Rate ) AS "Read Rate",
    AVG ( Write_Rate ) AS "Write Rate"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN vm_disk_name
                ELSE vm_disk_name || '*'
            END AS disk_name,
            history_datetime AS Time,
            AVG ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( read_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric / ( 1024 * 1024 ), 1 ) ) AS Read_Rate,
            AVG ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( write_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric / ( 1024 * 1024 ), 1 ) ) AS Write_Rate
        FROM 
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, read_rate_bytes_per_second, write_rate_bytes_per_second 
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, read_rate_bytes_per_second, write_rate_bytes_per_second 
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id =
                        statistics.vm_disk_id
                    )
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we filter by the latest vm disks configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS a
                        GROUP BY a.vm_disk_id
                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.vm_disk_id
                        FROM 
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, vm_disk_status, read_rate_bytes_per_second, write_rate_bytes_per_second 
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly 
                                UNION
                                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, vm_disk_status, read_rate_bytes_per_second, write_rate_bytes_per_second
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_daily
                                    WHERE
                                        history_datetime <
                                            (
                                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly
                                            )
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS c
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        c.vm_disk_id = 
                                        b.vm_disk_id
                                    )
                            WHERE
                                -- Here we filter by active vm disks only
                                b.vm_disk_status = 1
                                AND c.vm_disk_id 
                                    IN 
                                        (
                                            SELECT device_id
                                            FROM 
                                                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                                INNER JOIN 
                                                (
                                                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status
                                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                                    UNION
                                                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status
                                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                                                        WHERE
                                                            history_datetime <
                                                                (
                                                                    SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                                                )
                                                ) AS samples_hourly_daily
                                                    ON
                                                        (
                                                            samples_hourly_daily.vm_configuration_version =
                                                            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_configuration_version
                                                        )
                                            WHERE
                                                -- Here we filter by active vm only
                                                samples_hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
                                                -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
                                                AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
                                                AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                                                AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                                -- Here we get the latest vm devices configuration
                                                AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.history_id 
                                                    IN 
                                                        (
                                                            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                            FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices a
                                                            GROUP BY 
                                                                a.vm_id, 
                                                                a.device_id
                                                        )
                                        )
                                -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
                                AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                -- Here we get the latest vm disks configuration
                                AND c.history_id 
                                    IN 
                                        (
                                            SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                            FROM  v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS d
                                            GROUP BY d.vm_disk_id
                                        )
                            GROUP BY c.vm_disk_id
                            -- Here we sort by the disks that have the max read and write rate.
                            ORDER BY 
                                AVG ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( b.read_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric, 1 ) ) +
                                AVG ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( b.write_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric, 1 ) ) 
                                DESC
                    )
        GROUP BY
            statistics.vm_disk_id,
            disk_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    all_sub_queries.time, 
    disk_name
ORDER BY
    all_sub_queries.time,
    COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' )

panels.title: Disk Read and Write Rates (over time) (BR10A)

panels.description: Average read and write operations per second of the virtual machine disks, over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VM Disk Read_ops, Write_ops Usage
-- over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS disk_name,
    AVG ( Read_ops ) AS "Read ops",
    AVG ( Write_ops ) AS "Write ops"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN vm_disk_name
                ELSE vm_disk_name || '*'
            END AS disk_name,
            history_datetime AS Time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( read_ops_per_second, 0 ) ) AS Read_ops,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( write_ops_per_second, 0 ) ) AS Write_ops
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, read_ops_per_second, write_ops_per_second
                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id =
                        statistics.vm_disk_id
                    )
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user

            -- Here we filter by the latest vm disks configuration

                IN

                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS a

                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.vm_disk_id
                        FROM 
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, vm_disk_status, read_ops_per_second, write_ops_per_second
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS c
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        c.vm_disk_id = 
                                        b.vm_disk_id
                                    )
                            WHERE
                                -- Here we filter by active vm disks only
                                b.vm_disk_status = 1
                                AND c.vm_disk_id 
                                    IN 
                                        (
                                            SELECT device_id
                                            FROM 
                                                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                                INNER JOIN 
                                                (
                                                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status
                                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                                                ) AS samples_hourly_daily
                                                    ON
                                                        (
                                                            samples_hourly_daily.vm_configuration_version =
                                                            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_configuration_version
                                                        )
                                            WHERE
                                                -- Here we filter by active vm only
                                                samples_hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
                                                -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
                                                AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
                                                AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                                                AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                                -- Here we get the latest vm devices configuration
                                                AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.history_id 
                                                    IN 
                                                        (
                                                            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                            FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices a
                                                            GROUP BY 
                                                                a.vm_id,
                                                                a.device_id
                                                        )
                                        )
                                -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
                                AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                -- Here we get the latest vm disks configuration
                                AND c.history_id 
                                    IN 
                                        (
                                            SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                            FROM  v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS d
                                            GROUP BY d.vm_disk_id
                                        )
                            GROUP BY c.vm_disk_id
                            -- Here we sort by the disks that have the max read and write rate.
                            ORDER BY 
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.read_ops_per_second, 0 ) ) +
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.write_ops_per_second, 0 ) ) 
                                DESC
                    )
        GROUP BY
            statistics.vm_disk_id,
            disk_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY
    all_sub_queries.time,
    disk_name
ORDER BY
    all_sub_queries.time,
    COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' )

-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VM Disk Read_ops, Write_ops Usage
-- over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS disk_name,
    AVG ( Read_ops ) AS "Read ops",
    AVG ( Write_ops ) AS "Write ops"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN vm_disk_name
                ELSE vm_disk_name || '*'
            END AS disk_name,
            history_datetime AS Time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( read_ops_per_second, 0 ) ) AS Read_ops,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( write_ops_per_second, 0 ) ) AS Write_ops
        FROM 
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, read_ops_per_second, write_ops_per_second 
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, read_ops_per_second, write_ops_per_second

                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS a

                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.vm_disk_id
                        FROM 
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, vm_disk_status, read_ops_per_second, write_ops_per_second 
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly 
                                UNION

                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_daily
                                    WHERE
                                        history_datetime <
                                            (
                                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly
                                            )
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS c
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        c.vm_disk_id = 
                                        b.vm_disk_id
                                    )
                            WHERE
                                -- Here we filter by active vm disks only
                                b.vm_disk_status = 1
                                AND c.vm_disk_id 
                                    IN 
                                        (
                                            SELECT device_id
                                            FROM 
                                                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                                INNER JOIN 
                                                (
                                                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status
                                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                                    UNION
                                                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status
                                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                                                        WHERE
                                                            history_datetime <
                                                                (
                                                                    SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                                                )
                                                ) AS samples_hourly_daily
                                                    ON
                                                        (
                                                            samples_hourly_daily.vm_configuration_version =
                                                            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_configuration_version
                                                        )
                                            WHERE
                                                -- Here we filter by active vm only
                                                samples_hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
                                                -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
                                                AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id = ('$vm_id')
                                                AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                                                AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                                -- Here we get the latest vm devices configuration
                                                AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.history_id 
                                                    IN 
                                                        (
                                                            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                            FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices a
                                                            GROUP BY 
                                                                a.vm_id,
                                                                a.device_id
                                                        )
                                        )
                                -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
                                AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                -- Here we get the latest vm disks configuration
                                AND c.history_id 
                                    IN 
                                        (
                                            SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                            FROM  v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS d
                                            GROUP BY d.vm_disk_id
                                        )
                            GROUP BY c.vm_disk_id
                            -- Here we sort by the disks that have the max read and write rate.
                            ORDER BY 
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.read_ops_per_second, 0 ) ) +
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.write_ops_per_second, 0 ) ) 
                                DESC
                    )
        GROUP BY
            statistics.vm_disk_id,
            disk_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    all_sub_queries.time, 
    disk_name
ORDER BY
    all_sub_queries.time,
    COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' )

panels.title: Disk I/O operations/sec (over time) (BR10A)

panels.description: Average transmit and receive rates of the virtual machine interfaces, over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VM Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates
-- over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- using the samples and hourly tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS interface_name,
    AVG ( Rx_rate ) AS "Rx. Rate",
    AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS "Tx. Rate"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
                ELSE v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name || '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Rx_rate,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM 
            (    
                SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces
            ON 
                (
                    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id =
                    statistics.vm_interface_id
                )
        WHERE 
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest vm interfaces configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.vm_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.vm_interface_id
                        FROM     
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS c
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        c.vm_interface_id = 
                                        b.vm_interface_id
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS d
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        d.vm_configuration_version =
                                        c.vm_configuration_version
                                        AND d.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active vm only
                            d.vm_status = 1
                            -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
                            AND c.vm_interface_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT device_id
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                        WHERE 
                                            vm_id = ('$vm_id')
                                            AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                                            AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                            -- Here we get the latest vm devices configuration
                                            AND history_id 
                                                IN 
                                                    (
                                                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices AS a
                                                        GROUP BY 
                                                            a.vm_id,
                                                            a.device_id
                                                    )
                                    )
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.vm_interface_id
                                    )
                        GROUP BY c.vm_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                            AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                            AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) 
                            DESC
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    all_sub_queries.time, 
    interface_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VM Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates
-- over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS interface_name,
    AVG ( Rx_rate ) AS "Rx. Rate",
    AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS "Tx. Rate"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
                ELSE v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name || '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Rx_rate,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM 
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent 
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent 
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces
            ON 
                (
                    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id =
                    statistics.vm_interface_id
                )
        WHERE 
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest vm interfaces configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.vm_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.vm_interface_id
                        FROM     
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                UNION
                                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                                    WHERE
                                        history_datetime <
                                            (
                                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                            )
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS c
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        c.vm_interface_id = 
                                        b.vm_interface_id
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status 
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly 
                                UNION
                                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                                    WHERE
                                        history_datetime <
                                            (
                                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                            )
                            ) AS d
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        d.vm_configuration_version =
                                        c.vm_configuration_version
                                        AND d.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active vm only
                            d.vm_status = 1
                            -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
                            AND c.vm_interface_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT device_id
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                        WHERE 
                                            vm_id = ('$vm_id')
                                            AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                                            AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                            -- Here we get the latest vm devices configuration
                                            AND history_id 
                                                IN 
                                                    (
                                                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices AS a
                                                        GROUP BY 
                                                            a.vm_id,
                                                            a.device_id
                                                    )
                                    )
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.vm_interface_id
                                    )
                        GROUP BY c.vm_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                            AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                            AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) 
                            DESC
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    all_sub_queries.time, 
    interface_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

panels.title: Network Interface Tx and Rx Rates (over time) (BR10A)

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT   
    CAST ( vm_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  
    CASE          
        WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    
            THEN vm_name 	 	
        WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    
            THEN vm_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  
    END AS __text  		
FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms  		
WHERE       		    
    history_id           			    
        IN               				
            (  	             					
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms a  		         					
                GROUP BY a.vm_id 	         				
            ) 	 					
    AND 	    			    
        CASE  	        				    
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					   
                THEN 1=1 		    					
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    
                THEN v4_4_configuration_history_vms.delete_date ISNULL 	                
        END
list.label: Virtual Machine
list.name: vm_id
list.query:
SELECT DISTINCT   
    CAST ( vm_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  
    CASE          
        WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    
            THEN vm_name 	 	
        WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    
            THEN vm_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  
    END AS __text  		
FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms  		
WHERE       		    
    history_id           			    
        IN               				
            (  	             					
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms a  		         					
                GROUP BY a.vm_id 	         				
            ) 	 					
    AND 	    			    
        CASE  	        				    
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					   
                THEN 1=1 		    					
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    
                THEN v4_4_configuration_history_vms.delete_date ISNULL 	                
        END
